Description: Shoulder sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery neck-amphora; buff slip; exterior, from top: part of pendent lotus flower; single black band; painted decoration consisting of head of youth to right, with krobylos and a uraeus round his head (probably from a scene of Herakles and Busiris).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
See also LIMC III Bousiris 30, pl. 131.
Bibliographic references: Hogarth, Lorimer & Edgar 1905 / Naukratis 1903 (p. 121 pl. VI.1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 84, no. 8, pl. VI, no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.037)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 142-3, Nau 110, pl. 24b)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no. 113, pl. 14)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
